page.title: 03PIEL CASTLE
page.content: Piel Castle was built in the 12th century by the monks of nearby Furness Abbey.It was built as a point to prevent smuggling from Scotland and Ireland.However,the Monks used this as an excuse to smuggle goods themselves.Piel was also a garrison to help prevent foreign invasions,especially from Scotland. In 1327,the Monks rebuilt the castle with a great keep and inner and outer baileys.In 1487,a rival to King Henry 7th , called Lambert Simnel,landed at Piel with a force of 8000 men.He attempted to take the throne but he was unsuccessful.With the dissolution of Furness Abbey in 1537 the castle has steadily passed into ruin.It is now possible to visit the castle if you take the Ferry from Roa Island.
